TopicTitle: How do I get parts to not clip into each other/What parts won't clip?

Articles.Content: Hello, and I'm having serious problems building a rover. I'm trying to use structural parts and Jr. docking ports to build some epic suspension. At the bottom of the makeshift springs, I built a ring out of cubic struts attached to the hull to keep the whole assembly vertical. Well, it didn't work in the slightest. It clipped through like there was no tomorrow and flipped over. I couldn't find a thread or tutorial on the subject, so I thought I'd ask.
I'm not sure what your talking about. Can you post pictures?
The back of the cubic strut ring should be stopping the suspension upright, but it just goes right through.
Its because struts are pysicless parts. Physics don't apply to them so they clip through anything they are not attached to.
I believe parts don't collide with other parts when they're part of the same vessel.

I believe parts don't collide with other parts when they're part of the same vessel.

This seems to be the case. This build just got much more complicated. Thanks.
